means: 凯列班（莎士比亚剧<暴风雨>中半人半兽形怪物），<喻>丑恶而残忍的人

sentence.Network_en: He took too much pleasure in tormenting an ugly monster called Caliban.
sentence.Network_cn: 他喜欢一味捉弄一个名叫凯列班的丑妖怪.

sentence.Network_en: Homer would have bound Polyphemus with it, and Shakespeare, Caliban.
sentence.Network_cn: 荷马一定会用它来缚住波吕菲摩斯, 莎士沈亚用来缚住凯列班.

sentence.Network_en: Surprisingly, Caliban also mirrors and contrasts with Ferdinand in certain ways.
sentence.Network_cn: 令人惊讶地, 丑陋以特定的方式也和费迪南反映而且对比.

auth_sentence.content: There was no Caliban on Robinson Crusoe's island, just the eminently human Friday.

auth_sentence.content: Caliban, the subversive demiurge, made an unforgettable subterranean entrance: clawing his way into view from below the sand.
